meanings.sent1: The puppy will outgrow his small bed soon.
meanings.sent2: Children often outgrow their clothes quickly.
meanings.sent3: The plant seemed to outgrow its pot overnight!
meanings.sent4: Her ambitions outgrew her current job.
meanings.sent5: The tree's roots outgrew the planter, seeking more space.

meanings.sent1: The sunflower will outgrow the other flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Some kids outgrow their classmates in height.
meanings.sent3: The race car seemed to outgrow the others on the track.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outgrew his ability to contain it.
meanings.sent5: The skyscraper seemed to outgrow the clouds, reaching for the sky.

meanings.definition: Grow beyond or surpass in growth or development
meanings.sent1: Her intelligence will outgrow her peers in no time.
meanings.sent2: Some friendships can outgrow their initial stages.
meanings.sent3: The idea outgrew its original purpose, becoming something greater.
meanings.sent4: His talent outgrew the small town he grew up in.
meanings.sent5: The company's success outgrew all expectations, becoming a market leader.
